citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Vaccinations were not stored at the correct temperature per the label.
Five types of canine vaccines were stored in a cooler with a temperature of 31.9 degrees Fahrenheit according to the
inspector's Kestrel thermometer. All vaccine labels stated to store between 35-46 degrees Fahrenheit.
Vaccines not stored at correct temperature do not ensure that they are effective at treating disease or illness and the
health of the animals may suffer. Each dealer shall use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat
diseases and injuries. The facility must ensure all vaccinations are stored at the correct temperature per the label.
To be corrected by: 24-January-2024

The facility has failed to follow the Program of Veterinary approved by the Attending Veterinarian.
-10% of the kennel tested for blood parasites (heartworm) annually was not completed in 2023
-Ivermectin to adult dogs were either not written down or not given in August 2023
-Betsy #020 four puppies were to be given 5 days of Safeguard preventative and a Nobivac vaccine on 12-January-2024.
This was either not written down or not given to the puppies yet.
-Jewel #36 one puppy was to be given a Toltrazuril preventative on 13-January-2024. This was either not written down or
not given to the puppy yet.
The Program of Veterinary Care states all vaccines and medications are to be given +/- 3 days of due date, which that
timeline has surpassed at the time of inspection. Failure to follow the approved Program of Veterinary care's preventative
treatments does not ensure the animals are adequately protected from dangerous diseases and illnesses, which may
cause pain and unnecessary discomfort. Failure to complete routine sampling for blood parasites may cause the illness to
go undetected and untreated, which may cause pain and unnecessary discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the
approved Program of Veterinary Care and ensure all preventatives and sample testing are completed according to the
approved schedule.
To be corrected by: 31-January-2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Vaccinations were not stored at the correct temperature per the label. 
Five types of canine vaccines were stored in a cooler with a temperature of 31.9 degrees Fahrenheit according to the 
inspector's Kestrel thermometer. All vaccine labels stated to store between 35-46 degrees Fahrenheit.  
Vaccines not stored at correct temperature do not ensure that they are effective at treating disease or illness and the 
health of the animals may suffer. Each dealer shall use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat 
diseases and injuries. The facility must ensure all vaccinations are stored at the correct temperature per the label. 
To be corrected by: 24-January-2024 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has failed to follow the Program of Veterinary approved by the Attending Veterinarian. 
-10% of the kennel tested for blood parasites (heartworm) annually was not completed in 2023 
-Ivermectin to adult dogs were either not written down or not given in August 2023 
-Betsy #020 four puppies were to be given 5 days of Safeguard preventative and a Nobivac vaccine on 12-January-2024. 
This was either not written down or not given to the puppies yet. 
-Jewel #36 one puppy was to be given a Toltrazuril preventative on 13-January-2024. This was either not written down or 
not given to the puppy yet.  
The Program of Veterinary Care states all vaccines and medications are to be given +/- 3 days of due date, which that 
timeline has surpassed at the time of inspection. Failure to follow the approved Program of Veterinary care's preventative 
treatments does not ensure the animals are adequately protected from dangerous diseases and illnesses, which may 
cause pain and unnecessary discomfort. Failure to complete routine sampling for blood parasites may cause the illness to 
go undetected and untreated, which may cause pain and unnecessary discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the 
approved Program of Veterinary Care and ensure all preventatives and sample testing are completed according to the 
approved schedule. 
To be corrected by: 31-January-2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

n
